data.name: Label6.Text
data.value: To delete a customer, the representative must find the customer via their account number, it is the responsibility of the representative to verify that the returned customer is the one that should be deleted. The ‘Delete’ button will delete the customer, unless they have outstanding movie orders that must be returned. If they do not have outstanding movie orders, their customer data, phone numbers, and movie queue will be deleted. Their rental history and order data will be preserved.

data.name: Label5.Text
data.value: In order to edit a customer’s data, the representative must first find them via their account number. Once they have been found, their information will be auto-filled and is now ready for updating. After updating the information the needs changing, the representative can click the ‘Save’ button and, if the required fields have been filled, the information will be updated. If required fields have been left blank, the representative will be informed and the customer record will not be updated until all required fields have been filled.

data.name: Label4.Text
data.value: In order to add a new customer all fields (except for apartment number and phone numbers) must be completed. The customer’s account number will be automatically generated to insure a uniqueness. Upon filling in the field, the representative need only click ‘Add’, if any required fields have not been completed, the representative will be informed and the customer will not be added until they are completed.

data.name: Label3.Text
data.value: The Find Customer tab operates as a general purpose customer database query. Customers can be search via exact matching account number or by partial matching first name, last name, or email. Search key priority is from left (highest) to right (lowest). If no parameters are specified, the search will return all customers.

data.name: Label2.Text
data.value: To create an order, the representative must input the customer’s account number and click search. The search will return those movies in the customer’s movie queue that are currently in the inventory, sorted from highest priority to lowest priority, or oldest in the queue to newest in the queue. To complete an order, the representative must select which movie to order via the drop down list of movie id’s. The representative may enter a movie id that is not in the list but this should only be done with the customer’s express permission. The date field is pre-populated but can be adjusted if necessary. The ‘Record Order’ order button will complete the action if the customer is eligible to order another movie, based on their account type. On order creation, the movie is removed from the customer queue and the current inventory is reduced by 1.

data.name: Label8.Text
data.value: To generate a list of recommended movies for a customer, the customer account number must be provided. After that, the movie recommendations will be made automatically generated by the recommendation engine.
